title: Quiz 10: Education, Culture & Media
description: Assess your understanding of the Community-Based Approach, the role of culture, and how media influences disaster management.

questions.question: Why is the Community-Based Approach to public awareness considered effective?

options.text: It relies solely on international experts
Locals have the best knowledge of their environment and culture

questions.explanation: Locals know their environment, culture, and needs best, leading to ownership and sustainability.

questions.question: Which of the following are advantages of the Community-Based Approach? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Addresses immediate needs of the community
Provides knowledge and skills for the first 72 hours
Potential for misleading information if not trained properly

questions.explanation: Ownership, addressing needs, and skill provision are advantages. Misleading info is a disadvantage.

questions.question: Match the stakeholder to their role in community-based disaster management:

pairs.right: Reliable arms of local government for implementation
Prime responsibility for policy and legislation
Facilitate awareness training and skills transfer
Provide wide networks and professional activists

questions.hint: Match the group to their function.

questions.question: Indigenous knowledge systems should be ignored in favor of modern scientific methods during disaster awareness campaigns.
questions.explanation: Indigenous knowledge is a useful resource and should be integrated (e.g. traditional healing, signals).

questions.question: Review the scenario: 'A media report exaggerates looting in a disaster zone, causing panic and leading relief agencies to avoid the area.' This illustrates which effect of the media?

richContent.content: Breaking News: Widespread chaos and looting reported in the city center!

options.text: Negative effect: Creating unnecessary panic and distorted truth

questions.explanation: Exaggeration and inaccurate portrayal are negative effects that create panic and hinder response.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ is the behaviors and beliefs characteristic of a particular social, ethnic, or age group transmitted from one generation to another.
questions.explanation: Culture defines the way of life, beliefs, and behaviors.

questions.question: What are the Positive effects of media in disaster management? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Defining the event as an official disaster
Convergence of media personnel causing congestion

questions.explanation: Media helps define disasters, disseminate info, and lobby. Congestion is a negative effect.

questions.question: Rank the following dissemination methods from 'Low Interaction' to 'High Interaction/Engagement':
questions.explanation: Posters are passive. Radio is one-way. Theatre is engaging. Drills involve active participation.

questions.question: What is the term for a map which shows areas that are vulnerable to particular hazards such as earthquakes or flooding?
questions.explanation: A Hazard Map visualizes risk areas.

questions.question: School-based disaster programmes should only focus on the students and exclude law enforcement and parents.
questions.explanation: School programmes must link with the community, parents, and law enforcement for effective safety.
